title: A1398 820-00426 no eDP missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
Hey Guys,

Working on 820-00426 chime, fan spin but no display. Plugging HDMI or DP to external monitor screen works fine.
Sometimes at random time image appears on screen just for seconds then disappear.

[MEDIA=youtube]xwvmjQ_28fY[/MEDIA]

Board pretty clean, no visual liquid damage.

J8300 pin 1 = 0v (PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT). Sometimes give 50v then drop to 0v
J8300 pin 28-30 = 5v (PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD)
Q7706 pin 1,2,5,6 = 0v / pin 3 = 12v / pin 4 = 12v, try replace it but issue still persist
Replacing U7701 but no good result.
Found that missing LCD_BKLT_EN = 0v (should be 3.3v), that sent it out from U9600. Should i replace this chip ?!

title: A1398 820-00426 no eDP missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
If sometime got 50V, means open LED strip.
You may have bad LCD connector.
Try first compatible LCD assembly.
Look if image is always present; check LCD_HPD and PP3V3_S0_EDP_SW.

title: A1398 820-00426 no eDP missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 62066, member: 682"]
Try first compatible LCD assembly.
[/QUOTE]
Try with working LCD assembly with same model same year, same issue...no backlight no image

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 62066, member: 682"]
Look if image is always present; check LCD_HPD and PP3V3_S0_EDP_SW.
[/QUOTE]
With LCD attached and LogicBoard powered i do get at J8300
pin 5 (PP3V3_S0_EDP_SW) = 3.3v
pin 8 (LCD_BKLT_PWM_R) = 2.575v
pin 9 (LCD_HPD_CONN) = 3.3v

R8300 reads as 0ohm as per schematic.
L8300 = 5v at both pins

title: A1398 820-00426 no eDP missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
In such case, you should have image, but is not easy to detect it.

Check for activity on BKLT_SCL/SDA lines.
Intermitent backlight can be caused by bad solders around U/Q/D7701.
Post D7701 voltages when no backlight present.

LCD_BKLT_EN should be high, when you get 50V at K/D7701.

title: A1398 820-00426 no eDP missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 62079, member: 682"]
Check for activity on BKLT_SCL/SDA lines.
[/QUOTE]
R7757 : 0ohm (BKLT_SDA) = 4.789v 
R7758 : 0ohm (BKLT_SCL) = 4.790v

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 62079, member: 682"]
Intermitent backlight can be caused by bad solders around U/Q/D7701.
[/QUOTE]
Replaced U/Q/D7701 issue still persist.

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 62079, member: 682"]
Post D7701 voltages when no backlight present.
[/QUOTE]
D7701, pin1 = 0v / pin2 = 0v

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 62079, member: 682"]
LCD_BKLT_EN should be high, when you get 50V at K/D7701.
[/QUOTE]
LCD_BKLT_EN = 0v

title: A1398 820-00426 no eDP missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
"LCD_BKLT_EN = 0v"
You don't get 50V anymore at backlight output, to test it?

title: A1398 820-00426 no eDP missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 62098, member: 682"]
You don't get 50V anumore at backlight output, to test it?
[/QUOTE]
Yes.

That's why i'm suspicious with U9600 that generate LCD_BKLT_EN, should i reflow it first ???
Or just replace it ??

title: A1398 820-00426 no eDP missing LCD_BKLT_EN
message:
You can try to reflow, but should be better to reball it.
If still the same, the change it.
